result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa J. Hutkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa J. Hutkowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Melissa J. Hutkowski in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided at the pre-trial and there is resolution today.  Defendant agrees.  Defendant waives her right to an Attorney.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Defendant will pay today
of No Contact Provision of Bond

Statement of Compliance
(attempted to notify victimis of right)
Criminal Complaint served on Defendant @ MASO-Jail

Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Return date on July 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*No contact with victim M.N.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.


Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial

Defendant Melissa J. Hutkowski in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms defendant's address.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*No contact with victim M.N.  Return date scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 10:45 am.
